page.title: 12OPEN SPACES,NATURAL RESOURCE
page.content: Caldy Hill and Grange Hill are an important natural resource and goelogical feature of the area.They are composed mainly of sandstone which is featured in many of the older buildings in the area. Rising to a height of about 250 ft.above sea level they cover about 250 acres.With Newton Common and Stapledon Woods providing another 130 acres of land this major leisure resource which is part of the Wirral Country Park is also of great importance as a habitat for wild life of many kinds. The land is owned partly by the National Trust and by Wirral Borough Council.Wirral also control the Wirral Way which was formerly a railway line and was opened in its present form in 1973 and which is used by individuals and organisations for leisure use.
